alert.note: Alert for Coastal York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 6:10PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern York and southeastern Strafford Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 609 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Barrington, or near Durham, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rochester, Durham, Sanford, Dover, Somersworth, Kennebunk, Barrington, Berwick, Farmington, Lebanon, South Berwick, Newmarket, Wells, Lee, Acton, Madbury, Rollinsford, North Berwick, Milton and Nottingham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
